sen.j: 布部山の戦い（ふべやまのたたかい）とは、1570年（元亀元年）に山中幸盛率いる尼子氏再興軍とそれを阻止しようとする毛利氏との間に起こった戦いである。
sen.e: The Battle of Fubeyama (Mt. Fube) is a war between an army of the Amago clan which was directed by Yukimori YAMANAKA with an aim to reconstruct the Amago clan and the Mori clan who was attempting to prevent it.

sen.j: 1566年永禄9年11月28日に月山富田城が開城し、尼子家が滅びた後、尼子家家臣である山中幸盛・立原久綱達が尼子家再興を目指すため、1568年、京都・東福寺に逃れていた新宮党の尼子誠久の子である尼子勝久を還俗させ、擁立した。
sen.e: After the Amago clan surrendered Gassantoda Castle to the Mori clan November 28, 1566 and the Amago family fell, in order to reconstruct the Amago family, Yukimori YAMANAKA and Hisatsuna TACHIHARA, the past vassals of the family worked to let Katsuhisa AMAGO who was son of Sanehisa AMAGO and a member of Shingu-to (party) return to secular life from Tofukuji Temple in Kyoto and back him up in 1568.

sen.j: 翌年、但馬、隠岐を経て出雲に上陸した後、尼子再興の伝令を発すると、5日後には尼子勝久の元に尼子家旧家臣、3000の軍勢が集まった。
sen.e: After they reached Izumo through Tajima and Oki the next year, they dispatched a messenger about the intention of the reconstruction of the Amago family, and in five days three thousand troops consisting of former vassals of the Amago family gathered for Katsuhisa AMAGO.

sen.j: 最初に新山城を陥落させ、出雲国の旧領をほぼ制圧し、破竹の勢いで月山富田城に向かったが、守兵300であるにも関わらず天野隆重が守る難攻不落の険城をなかなか落とすことができなかった。
sen.e: First they took most of their former territories in Izumo Province in control by destructing Shinyama Castle and advanced unresisted to attack Gassantoda Castle, but the castle was so tightly guarded by Takashige AMANO and inaccessible and impregnable that they had a lot of troubles destroying the castle, while the castle was guarded by only three hundred warriors.

sen.j: 隠岐為清の反乱等も重なり手をこまねいていた所へ、伊予国・北部九州へ出兵していた毛利家主力が戻り、毛利輝元・吉川元春・小早川隆景以下、13000の大軍は石見国から出雲国を目指した。
sen.e: When they had a lot more difficulties with the rebellion of Tamekiyo OKI as well, the main force of the Mori family returned from battles in Iyo Province and northern part of Kyushu, and a large army of 13,000 including Terumoto MORI, Motoharu KIKKAWA and Takakage KOBAYAKAWA left Iwami Province for Izumo Province.

sen.j: これを知った尼子勢は毛利勢を食い止める為、末次城に尼子勝久を残して石見路から月山富田城に行く際に通る布部山で毛利を食い止める事とした。
sen.e: As the Amago army became aware of their movement, they decided to have Katsuhisa AMAGO stay at Suetsugu Castle and stop Mori in Fubeyama they would go through to reach Gassantoda Castle from Iwamiji Road.

sen.j: 尼子勢は布部山の2つしかない登り口(水谷口・中山口)に山中幸盛を大将とする総勢6800の兵を布陣し、万全の体制で毛利軍を待ち構えた。
sen.e: The Amago army sent a total of 68,000 soldiers who were directed by Yukimori YAMANAKA to only two gateways (Mizutani (水谷) gateway and Nakayama (中山) gateway) to Fubeyama and waited for the Mori troops, taking all possible measures.

sen.j: 戦いは当初地の利に勝る尼子勢が優勢だったが、攻め落とすのが難しいと判断した吉川元春が住民に間道を教えてもらい、別働隊を率いて裏から布部山の頂上に登った。
sen.e: While the Amago army was initially dominant due to the advantageous location, Motoharu KIKKAWA found it difficult to defeat the Amago army and obtained information about a by-path from local residents and went up to the top of Fubeyama from the rear side of the mountain, leading a troop which was separately prepared.

sen.j: そこから尼子軍の本陣を強襲したところ尼子勢は総崩れとなり敗走した。
sen.e: They stormed the troop headquarters of the Amago army from the top of Fubeyama, and the Amago army completely broke down and ran away.
